title: Executive Assistant
description:
This position requires candidate to be BASED in SINGAPORE



FULL JOB DESCRIPTION



The main purpose of this role is to provide administrative, clerical, and personal support to Director.



Provide comprehensive executive and personal assistance to the Director, including managing calendars, coordinating schedules, meetings, appointments.

Handle, prioritise, and respond to
s, calls and messages on behalf of the Director, maintaining professional communication at all times.

Organize and maintain both physical and digital files in a systematic and accessible manner.

Conduct research and deliver information promptly upon request.

Prepare a range of documents, including reports, memos, notes, presentations, and other supporting materials.

Research, plan, and coordinate comprehensive travel arrangements—covering flights, transportation, accommodation, dining, and event bookings.

Manage highly confidential information and sensitive matters with professionalism, discretion, and sound judgment.

Coordinate lifestyle-related arrangements, including dining reservations, event planning, entertainment scheduling, and leisure activities.

Assist with family-related tasks such as school matters, medical appointments, and travel plans.

Uphold confidentiality and safeguard the employer’s personal and business information.

Undertake ad hoc tasks or assignments when needed.



Qualifications,Skills and Experience:



Minimum 3 years proven work experience.

Strong language, business, or hospitality background an advantage.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to anticipate needs, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects.

Proficiency in MS Office software and other productivity tools for preparing reports, presentations, and documents management.

High level of integrity, discretion, and commitment to confidentiality.

Work under pressure and adapt to changing circumstances and workload.

Possess driving license preferred.



Other Attributes:



Flexible and willing to travel internationally, sometimes on short notice.

Desire to continuously update skills in line with new technologies and administrative methods.

Excellent communication skills with all levels of stakeholders, internal and external.

Strong organizational skills including attention to details, multi-tasking skills and time management skills.

Good interpersonal skills with a positive attitude to build strong relationships with stakeholders.

Self-motivated and proactive with demonstrated ability to set priorities and meet deadlines.

description:
We are seeking a YouTube AI Content Creator who can leverage AI Agent tools to research, collect data, and transform insights into engaging, high-quality videos. The ideal candidate will have a strong sense of storytelling, visual creativity, and hands-on experience in video editing and channel management.



Key Responsibilities

* Use AI Agent tools to automate workflows, streamline research, and organize data efficiently

* Handle graphic design, scriptwriting, footage collection, AI voiceovers, video editing, and background music integration

* Create eye-catching thumbnails, SEO-optimized descriptions, and tags to boost visibility and engagement

* Set up and manage a YouTube channel, including profile design, cover art, logo, intro/outro, and ongoing content updates

* Ensure all content complies with YouTube’s policies and community guidelines



Qualifications

* Proven experience managing and growing YouTube channels

* Strong understanding of AI Agent tools, YouTube analytics, and content optimization

* Proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, or similar)

* Knowledge of SEO strategies and audience engagement techniques

* Excellent attention to detail, creativity, and communication skills



If you’re a creative professional who can blend AI innovation with YouTube storytelling, we’d love to work with you.

Not a designer. A revenue printer.



We are not looking for someone to “make pages look nice.”

We are looking for someone who knows how to turn traffic into money.



If you live and breathe conversion rates, offers, hooks, psychology, and AOV… keep reading.



If you’re a Canva designer who likes pretty layouts… this will be painful for you.



Who We Are



We run multiple fast growing ecommerce brands in:



Tactical and concealed carry

Skincare and personal care

Direct to consumer premium products



We drive traffic fro
ta,
, TikTok, creators, and paid media.

Your job is simple.



Turn that traffic into revenue.



Not theory. Not fluff.

Real conversion increases.



Your Mission



- Increase conversion rate

- Increase average order value

- Build pages that make customers buy now



You will build, optimize, and test:



- Product landing pages

- Advertorials

- Bundle pages

- Offer pages

-
 capture pages

Everything must be built with one goal:

More revenue per visitor.



This Is NOT A Design Job



We don’t care if you can pick pretty fonts.



We care if you understand:

- Customer psychology

- Direct response copy

- Objection handling

- Offer structure

- Conversion flow



If you cannot write persuasive copy and structure a high converting page

you will not succeed here.



What You Must Be Elite At

- CTA flow

High level DTC brands

- Bundles and upsells

- Speed and layout performance

4. Offer & Funnel Strategy



You don’t just build pages.



You think:

- What offer converts best

- How to increase AOV

- What bundle structure works

- What order bumps to add

- What upsells to test

- What funnel structure to use



You think like a growth operator, not a page builder.



5. Testing & Optimization Mindset



You never believe a page is finished.



You constantly think:

- What headline should we test

- What hero converts best

- Video vs static

- UGC vs studio

- Short vs long page

- Price anchoring

You love testing and improving.



6. Brand Awareness



We are building premium brands.



Not spammy dropshipping pages.



You must be able to build:

- Premium tactical brand pages

- High trust skincare pages

- Luxury feel with high conversion



Clean. Sharp. Persuasive.

Never cheap looking.







Who You Are

title: Long-Form YouTube Video Editor (AI Video / Veo3).

I need someone who can take my scripts and turn them into finished, cinematic YouTube videos using AI video tools — primarily Google Veo3 (or similar tools like Runway, Kling, etc.)

I handle all scripting. You handle everything else: AI video generation, editing, pacing, music, sound design, and final delivery.

This is NOT traditional video editing. You won't be cutting raw camera footage. You'll be creating visuals from scratch using AI prompts, then assembling them into a polished, cinematic video.

 edits

Structured narrative that keeps viewers watching



If you watch those channels and think "I can do this" — keep reading.

If you watch them and feel lost — this isn't for you. No hard feelings.

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

WHO YOU ARE (must-haves)

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

 You have real experience with AI video generation tools (Veo3, Runway, Kling, Pika, or similar)

 You can write effective AI prompts that produce cinematic, consistent results

 You understand narrative structure — you know how to pace a 20-minute story

 You can edit 10+ minute long-form videos (not TikToks, not Reels — real YouTube content)

 You use music and sound effects strategically, not randomly

 You work independently — I send you a script, you deliver a finished video

 You suggest creative improvements instead of just following instructions blindly

 NOT a fit if:

? You've never used AI video tools (this is not a training position)

? You only do short-form content (under 5 minutes)

? You need step-by-step instructions for every single scene

? You can't handle feedback or revisions

? You disappear for days without communication

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

WHAT YOU GET

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

 Pay: Starting at $400/month

? If your quality is consistently high, salary increases. This is not a ceiling, it's a starting point.

? Top performer can realistically reach $
/month within 3-6 months.

 Volume: 60 videos/month (15/week)

 Location: Remote, any timezone (but deadlines are deadlines)

 Growth: I'm scaling to more channels. Good work = more work = more pay.

 Start: This week if you're ready

 Bonus: This is a long-term position. I'm not looking for a one-month freelancer. I want someone who grows with the channels.

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

HOW TO APPLY (read this carefully — seriously)

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

DO NOT send a generic "I'm interested" message.

I get hundreds of those. They all go straight to trash.

Instead, do this:

 Write the word "GLACIER" at the very top of your message.

? This proves you actually read the whole post. No GLACIER = I won't read your application.

 Send me at least one longer video (8+ minutes) that YOU personally edited.

? Bonus points if it uses AI-generated visuals.

? If you don't have a long-form sample, don't apply.

 Briefly explain:

? What software do you use for editing?

? What's your experience with AI video tools? (Which ones? How long?)

? How do you approach structuring a long-form video from a script?

 Watch one of the reference channels above and tell me:

? What do they do well?

? What would you do differently?

 Applications without "GLACIER" at the top = automatically ignored. No exceptions.

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

WHY WORK WITH ME?

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

Honest truth:

 I pay on time, every month. No chasing, no excuses.

 I give clear, specific feedback — not vague "make it better" nonsense.

 Steady, consistent work — not a random one-off project.

 I handle all the scripting — you focus purely on the visual/editing side.

 Room to grow as channels scale.

 I'm picky about quality. If pacing is off, I'll ask for revisions.

 Volume is real — 60 videos/month means you need to be efficient.

 I expect communication — if something is delayed, tell me before the deadline, not after.

If you understand structure, pacing, AI tools, and storytelling — we can build something long-term together.

If this sounds like you, apply now.

If not, no hard feelings — save us both the time.

George

title: Business Outreach & Client Research Specialist (US Businesses)
description:
Business Outreach & Client Research Specialist (US Businesses)

Rate: $8/hour | Long-Term Remote Role



About Us

We are a U.S.-based company that works with service businesses across the United States such as cleaning companies, HVAC companies, plumbers, electricians, pest control companies, and other local service providers.



Many of these businesses are growing quickly and are hiring office staff to keep up with scheduling, customer communication, and daily operations.



Our team studies how these companies operate so we can better support them.

We are looking for someone who is comfortable speaking with business owners, asking thoughtful questions, and documenting what they share.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Researching service businesses in the United States

• Reaching out to business owners by phone or message

• Asking a few structured questions about how their operations work

• Listening carefully and documenting information clearly

• Identifying businesses that may want to learn more about our services

• Sharing insights with our internal team



You will follow a simple outreach framework that we provide.



This role involves real conversations with real business owners.



Communication Expectations

You will regularly speak with business owners in the United States.

You should be comfortable:

• Starting conversations with people you haven’t met before

• Asking questions and guiding a short discussion

• Listening carefully and responding naturally

• Keeping conversations calm and professional

• Handling occasional rejection without getting discouraged

Strong spoken English is important for this role.



Who This Role Is Best For

People with experience in:

• business outreach

• lead research

• appointment setting

• market research

• customer-facing virtual assistant roles

• client communication

• business development support



If you enjoy understanding how businesses operate and speaking with decision makers, you will likely do well here.



Important Traits

We’re looking for someone who is:

• Comfortable speaking with strangers

• Curious about how businesses run

• Organized with notes and follow-up

• Consistent and reliable

• Calm and professional on calls

• Self-motivated



This is not a passive admin role.

You will be actively communicating with businesses.



Typical Day

Your day may include:

• researching businesses

• starting conversations with owners

• asking questions about their operations

• documenting responses

• identifying businesses that want more information

• sharing feedback with our team



Equipment Requirements

• Reliable internet connection

• Quiet work environment

• Computer capable of running web applications

• Headset or microphone for clear calls



Opportunity

People who perform well in this role often take on larger responsibilities within our team, including roles that involve deeper client interaction and business growth.



Application Questions(Required)

Please answer the following when applying:



Are you comfortable speaking with business owners in the United States?

Have you worked in outreach, appointment setting, or client communication before?

How many phone conversations per day are you comfortable starting?

Tell us about a time you had to ask questions to understand a business problem.

Why do you think you would be a good fit for this role?



Final Step(Required)

Please include a short voice recording (30–60 seconds) answering this question:

“If you called a business owner who was busy, how would you start the conversation?”



This helps us understand communication style.

title: Multifamily Analyst
description:
About Avita



OTH Capital / Avita Property Management is a tech-enabled, data-driven multifamily platform managing ~5,000+ units across Texas and ~$800M in asset value.



We operate with an ownership mentality — focused on NOI growth, operational accountability, and institutional-grade reporting. We are building a centralized analytics team to support portfolio-level decision-making as we scale.



Role Overview



The Multifamily Analyst will support executive leadership, asset management, and operations by providing real-time analytics, financial modeling, and performance insights across the portfolio.



This role goes beyond reporting — it drives strategic decisions around:



Revenue optimization



Budget performance



Occupancy stabilization



Delinquency control



Market positioning



You will work directly with U.S.-based Regional Managers and Executive Leadership.



Core Responsibilities

Revenue & Occupancy Analytics

Analyze leasing velocity, renewal trends, concessions

Monitor occupancy vs. pro forma and budget

Support pricing recommendations

Track net effective rent trends



Financial & Budget Analysis

Prepare monthly budget vs. actual variance reports

Identify expense anomalies and revenue leakage

Support annual budgeting process

Assist with cash flow forecasting



Delinquency & Risk Monitoring

Track portfolio-wide delinquency

Analyze collections performance

Support structured collections strategy

Flag operational risks early



Market Intelligence

Perform submarket comp analysis (Texas focus)

Monitor new supply deliveries

Track rent growth trends



Executive Reporting

Build weekly KPI dashboards

Prepare monthly portfolio summary for leadership

Support board-level reporting

Maintain standardized data models



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related

3–6 years analytical experience

Advanced Excel (required)

Strong written English



Experience supporting U.S. clients preferred



Real estate / multifamily exposure strongly preferred



Compensation

$8–10 USD per hour (based on experience)

Performance bonus eligibility (quarterly)



30–60–90 Day Performance Roadmap

This is critical for scaling with intention.



First 30 Days – Understand & Build Foundations



Goal: Learn Avita’s operating model and data stack.

Review portfolio P&Ls and KPIs

Understand rent roll structure

Learn delinquency reporting format

Shadow Regional Manager meetings

Audit current reporting templates

Identify inconsistencies in data tracking



Deliverable:

Cleaned KPI master dashboard (baseline version)

1-page performance summary template



Day 31–60 – Analyze & Improve

Goal: Move from reporting ? insight.

Identify top 5 revenue leakage areas



Highlight delinquency outliers

Provide first renewal strategy analysis

Create variance analysis tracker

Standardize weekly revenue reporting



Deliverable:

Executive-ready Weekly Portfolio Performance Report

Revenue improvement action memo



Day 61–90 – Drive Strategy

Goal: Become a strategic contributor.

Build 6-month occupancy forecast model

Recommend pricing or concession adjustments



Identify underperforming assets

Propose KPI thresholds for early warning system

Support budget assumptions modeling



Deliverable:

Forward-looking Portfolio Forecast Model

Quarterly Revenue Strategy Presentation

By Day 90, this person should:

Be influencing decision-making

Flagging issues before they escalate



Operating independently

KPI Scorecard for Multifamily Analyst

This is how you hold them accountable.



Revenue Performance Metrics

Occupancy % vs Budget

Net Effective Rent Growth

Renewal Rate %

Concession % of GPR

Delinquency Metrics

Delinquency % of GPR



30/60/90-day aging trend

Bad debt write-offs trend

Financial Accuracy Metrics

Budget variance accuracy

Forecast accuracy (within 3–5%)

Timeliness of weekly reports

Data error rate

title: Distressed Property Specialist (U.S. Accent Only)
description:
Note: This is NOT a VA job. Apply ONLY if you have strong ASSET RECOVERY experience.

This is NOT cold calling.

This is NOT boiler-room sales.

This is NOT pressure-based scripting.

This is high-level, consultative work with families who need clarity, empathy, and a strong communicator who can guide them.





Are you exceptional at talking to people in difficult situations?

Have you worked in collections, recovery, or loss mitigation?

Can you stay calm when someone is emotional, frustrated, or overwhelmed?

Do you have a clear U.S. or U.S-neutral accent and the ability to connect quickly?



If yes — this is the best career move you will ever make.



We are a real estate investment company that works with:



families handling a deceased loved one’s property

heirs who inherited land or homes with complications

owners who are behind on taxes or mortgage

siblings who can’t agree on what to do with a property

families trying to avoid foreclosure

people dealing with probate, title issues, or liens



Your job is to help these families find a solution, earn their trust, and guide them through a clean, fair transaction.



YOUR ROLE (WHAT YOU WILL ACTUALLY DO)

1. Speak with heirs, relatives, and decision-makers



deceased owner situations

no probate filed

3–7 heirs with conflicting opinions

tax foreclosure deadlines

mortgage default

family disagreements

emotional conversations



This requires emotional intelligence and patience.



2. Build trust FAST



Good people trust you because you sound calm, professional, and transparent.



You will not sound like a wholesaler or telemarketer.

You will sound like a solution provider.



3. Offer realistic, helpful options



You will help them understand choices like:



buying out their share

paying taxes to save time

helping with probate

delaying foreclosure

purchasing fractional interests

resolving family disagreements

You are a guide, not a salesperson.



4. Negotiate respectfully and intelligently



You must know how to:



de-escalate tension

uncover motivations

negotiate price & terms

coordinate multiple heirs

communicate step-by-step

keep the process moving without pressure



5. Follow up like a professional



Deals often happen:



after the 3rd–7th conversation

when a sibling changes their mind

when someone finally picks up

when emotions settle

You must track your pipeline and follow up consistently.



WHO WILL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE (OUR IDEAL MATCH)



We want someone who has succeeded in roles like:



Senior Recovery Specialist

Asset Recovery Specialist

Debt Collections Specialist

Loss Mitigation Specialist

Delinquent Account Negotiator

Foreclosure Outreach Agent

Mortgage Hardship Counselor

Auto Repossession Negotiator

Medical Bill Settlement Specialist



If you’ve handled:



a) emotional people

b) people behind on payments

c) delinquent accounts

d) bankruptcy or loss situations

e) high-friction conversations

f) families under pressure

g) financial stress cases



…you will excel here.



You understand:



psychology

money pressure

family conflict

urgency

decision-making under stress



This is EXACTLY what our sellers face.



REQUIREMENTS (STRICT)



MUST HAVE:



Clear U.S. or U.S-Southern accent

Minimum 3 years in recovery, collections, or hardship negotiations

Excellent conversational control

Ability to stay calm with emotional sellers

Strong problem-solving ability

Excellent note-taking and follow-up discipline

Ability to understand simple legal concepts

Quiet work environment & reliable internet



PREFERRED:



Experience with heirs, probate, foreclosure, or title issues

Experience coordinating multiple decision-makers

Real estate or legal background

High empathy & strong emotional intelligence



NOT ACCEPTED (0% consideration):



noticeable foreign accents

cold-calling experience only

“scripted telemarketer” style

BPO boiler-room callers

anyone who sounds like a wholesaler

people who pressure, push, or rush sellers

VAs with no negotiation background



COMPENSATION & STRUCTURE



Competitive hourly pay (based on experience)

Performance bonuses per signed agreement

Long-term, stable role

Daily script guidance + coaching

Work hours: 11:30 AM to 8:00 PM US EST

Small, professional team

High-quality leads provided daily

Support from genealogist, researcher, and title abstractor

This is a career, not a calling gig.



TO APPLY



Required — Applications without these will be ignored:



A 30–60 second voice recording introducing yourself

Explanation of your recovery/collections experience

A real example of a difficult conversation you handled

Your availability (days & time zone)

Expected hourly rate

title: Probate Heir-Tracing Research Analyst (U.S. Public Records)
description:
Note: This is NOT a VA job. Apply ONLY if you have strong RESEARCH experience.



We need a Probate Heir-Tracing Research Analyst who can quickly and accurately identify heirs and confirm basic ownership logic.



Responsibilities:



• Locate and verify U.S. obituaries

• Confirm spouse, children, and predeceased children

• Identify grandchildren (when a child is deceased)

• Reconstruct family relationships from obituary + public records

• Apply basic NC intestacy rules to determine who legally inherits

• Check county probate portals for existing cases

• Identify missing heirs or red flags

• Build clean reports for our acquisition team

• Provide proof links and screenshots for each finding



Requirements:



• Strong English reading comprehension

• Strong logic and ability to interpret relationships

• Experience with public records, skip tracing, genealogy, legal research, or investigations

• Ability to find obituaries and cross-verify with multiple sources

• Ability to follow structured checklists

• Fast turnaround, high reliability

• Good computer and internet skills



Preferred:



• Experience with U.S. inheritance concepts (spouse ? children ? grandchildren)

• Ability to calculate simple fractional shares

• Experience in probate or estate research

• Knowledge of terms like “predeceased,” “issue,” “intestate,” “per stirpes”

• Experience researching NC public records



To Apply:



Please answer:



Do you have experience with probate, genealogy, public records, or skip tracing?

Have you analyzed a U.S. obituary before?

What tools do you use for research?

Can you identify heirs from an obituary and verify probate?

What is your expected hourly rate and available hours?



We are looking for the absolute best and so there will be 3 rounds of screening test.

title: BreakBites Support (VA) – Parlevel (VMS) + Spreadsheets + Customer Support
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

BreakBites is a vending and micro market business in the U.S. We are hiring a Virtual Assistant for our **BreakBites Support** role. This is a process-based position focused on supporting operations through our VMS (Parlevel), spreadsheets, customer support, and documentation. You will follow SOPs, route customers into our existing forms and processes, keep our systems organized and accurate, and help us continuously improve our workflows.



This role requires someone who is a **fast learner**, detail-oriented, and consistent.



---



## CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



### 1) Parlevel (VMS Dashboard) – Primary



You will primarily use the **Parlevel web dashboard** (mobile app may be used occasionally). Tasks include:



* Pull **sales reports** by location/machine

* Pull **product performance** reports (what sells, what does not)

* Flag **machine issues** and patterns (errors, card reader issues, bill validator issues, outages, recurring problems)

* Update and maintain **route notes** / service notes by location

* Build or export **restock lists** and operational reports as needed

* Help identify trends and issues that affect inventory accuracy and customer experience



### 2) Spreadsheets + Documentation (Excel/Word)



* Update trackers in **Excel** (inventory notes, product lists, location notes, expiration lead times)

* Track and maintain estimated **expiration lead times** by product

* Log and organize recurring issues (barcode problems, scan issues, price mismatch notes)

* Keep files organized in a clean folder structure and follow naming rules



### 3) Customer Support (Calls, Texts,
)



You will handle incoming customer communication and route customers through our process.



* Respond to calls/texts/emails professionally as BreakBites Support

* Direct customers to the correct **refund/issue form** whenever possible

* If no form exists for the situation, collect the key details and log the issue

* You are **not** responsible for issuing cash refunds or coupon codes unless explicitly approved

* If you do not know the answer, use this approach: **“Let me confirm with my supervisor and get back to you.”**



### 4) Connecteam Support (Light Oversight)



* Review Connecteam updates and ensure employees are where they should be (GPS/check-ins as needed)

* Review basic team posts and operational updates

* Assist with ensuring training videos/tasks (like stocking/sorting content) are being followed

  (This is a smaller part of the role compared to Parlevel and admin work.)



### 5) Minor Video Editing



* Perform simple edits like trimming clips, removing dead time, basic organizing/exports, and preparing videos for upload

* Follow naming rules and upload videos to the correct folders (Google Drive or other storage we use)



### 6) SOP Creation and Updates



* Create and update SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) based on our workflows

* Convert processes into clear step-by-step checklists that a tea
mber can follow independently

* Keep SOPs organized and formatted consistently (Word/Google Docs)



---



## WORK SCHEDULE



* **Part-time:** 15–20 hours/week

* **Workdays:** Monday–Friday

* **Availability:** Preferred within **8:00 AM–5:00 PM CST**



---



## TOOLS YOU WILL USE



* Parlevel (VMS)

* Excel + Word

* Gmail

* Connecteam

* ChatGPT



---



## MUST HAVE



* Fast learner

* Strong attention to detail

* Comfortable with dashboards and spreadsheets

* Strong written English and clear communication

* Reliable internet + dependable work habits

* Can follow SOPs and processes without constant supervision

title: CRM Operations & Data Intelligence Manager (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a highly detail-oriented and analytical CRM Operations & Data Intelligence Manager to help turn messy data into clean, structured, and actionable insights.



This role combines data cleaning, team coordination, research, and structured profile evaluation. If you are organized, investigative, and comfortable making judgment calls using limited information, this role may be a strong fit.



Key Responsibilities



CRM & Data Management

 • Coordinate with a small team of data entry associates

 • Set and maintain quality standards for data accuracy

 • Clean, normalize, and structure large datasets

 • Identify duplicates, inconsistencies, and incomplete records

 • Improve tagging systems and overall data hygiene



Data Enrichment & Research

 • Review Instagram conversations, profiles, and photos

 • Infer likely location, age range, and other demographic indicators

 • Cross-reference available digital clues to improve profile completeness

 • Create clear documentation to standardize enrichment processes



Profile Scoring & Segmentation

 • Help develop structured scoring frameworks (e.g., profile quality, engagement potential)

 • Evaluate profiles using defined criteria

 • Support segmentation and filtering strategies

 • Provide insights to improve targeting and matching



Qualifications

 • Strong attention to detail

 • Analytical and structured thinker

 • Comfortable working with incomplete information

 • Experience with data cleaning and spreadsheets (Google Sheets, Excel, Airtable, or CRM systems)

 • Strong written English

 • Able to work independently and manage tasks with minimal supervision



Preferred Experience

 • Experience with CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, or similar)

 • Experience in growth, marketplace, creator, dating, or lead-generation environments

 • Experience coordinating remote tea
mbers



Role Details

 • Remote position

 • Full-time preferred

 • Long-term opportunity

 • Compensation based on experience



To Apply



Please submit:

 1. A short introduction describing your experience with data cleaning and research

 2. Tools you have used

 3. A brief example of how you inferred missing information from limited data

title: Customer Support Specialist (B2B SaaS – Intercom, Email, Occasional Calls) Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term
description:
We’re a fast-growing B2B SaaS company serving home service businesses across the U.S., and we’re looking for a sharp, reliable Customer Support Specialist to join our team.



If you love helping business owners solve real problems, enjoy learning software inside and out, and take pride in clear communication, keep reading.



What You’ll Be Doing



Responding to customer support tickets inside Intercom



Answering and managing support
s



Helping customers troubleshoot issues step-by-step



Training new customers on how to use our software (chat, Loom videos, or Zoom)



Following up with customers to ensure problems are fully resolved



Occasionally hopping on phone calls with customers when needed



Documenting common issues and helping us improve our help docs



Escalating technical issues clearly to our development team



This is not a “copy and paste replies” job. You’ll need to think, solve problems, and genuinely care about helping customers win.



Who This Is For



You’re a great fit if you:



Have 2+ years of customer support experience, ideally in SaaS



Have worked with tools like Intercom, Zendesk, HelpScout, or similar



Write clear, natural, professional English



Are confident explaining software to non-technical business owners



Can stay calm with frustrated customers and turn situations around



Are highly organized and detail-oriented



Can work independently without constant supervision



Have reliable internet and a quiet workspace



Are comfortable occasionally getting on voice calls



Bonus points if:



You’ve worked with CRM, FSM, or home service software



You’ve created Loom videos or help documentation before



You understand basic technical concepts



What We Care About Most



Speed of response



Clear communication



Ownership mentality



Actually solving the problem, not just replying



Treating customers like real humans



We move fast. Our customers rely on our software to run their businesses. Your role directly impacts retention and growth.



Schedule & Pay



Full-time



U.S. business hours (exact shift to be discussed)



Competitive pay based on experience



Long-term opportunity with room to grow



How to Apply



Start your application with the word “Autopilot” so we know you read this.



Tell us about your experience in SaaS customer support.



Describe a time you handled a difficult customer.



Record a short 1–2 minute Loom video explaining why you’d be a great fit.



Confirm your internet speed and your availability in U.S. time zones.



We are looking for someone long-term who wants to grow with a serious company.



If that’s you, apply now.

title: Video Editor - Long Term Role
description:
We’re hiring an experienced Video Editor to create short-form video ads for paid advertising across Sweden, Denmark, and Norway.



This is not basic editing and not content repurposing.

You must understand how ads convert, how to build trust visually, and how to hook viewers within the first seconds.



???? How the Role Works



For each project, you will receive:



A pre-written voice-over



Clear creative direction & goal



Access to a large library of existing product content



Your job is to:



Creatively build the video around the voice-over



Select the best clips from our existing content library



Source additional commercial-safe clips when needed



Choose and place visuals that:



Build trust



Support the message



Increase watch time & conversions



Select and implement strong hooks and/or CTA variations that fit the script



Edit pacing, captions, and visuals to feel natural, premium, and credible



You are responsible for visual storytelling, not just cutting clips.



???? Output & Batch Structure



1 batch = 1–5 videos



Videos are usually variations of the same base edit



Differences may include hook, CTA, or opening sequence



Video length:



20 seconds up to 2 minutes



Average: ~40 seconds



Expected time per batch: ~1–2 hours



This role rewards efficiency without sacrificing quality.



???? Skills & Experience Required (Non-Negotiable)



Proven experience editing short-form ad videos



Strong understanding of:



Hooks & attention capture



Trust-building visuals



Conversion-focused editing



Ability to judge which clips improve credibility and performance



Comfortable sourcing commercial-safe footage when needed



Understand how to visually support a voice-over script



Strong pacing, structure, and attention to detail



Comfortable working with structured feedback and workflows



???? Not suitable for beginners or purely aesthetic editors.



???? Tools You’ll Use



Video editing software (Premiere Pro, CapCut, Final Cut, etc.)



Internal content library + external clip sources



Notion-based workflow for delivery and feedback



???? Market



Target regions: Sweden, Denmark, Norway



Content must feel:



Trustworthy



Premium



Natural to Scandinavian audiences



???? Pay & Work Details



Fully remote



Consistent, long-term work



Pay per batch or per video (discussed after trial) (per hour) (per month)



???? Trial Edit Required

Shortlisted candidates will complete a test batch (1–2 videos) using:



A real voice-over



Access to our content library



The trial evaluates:



Hook quality



Clip selection



Trust-building execution



Overall conversion potential



???? How to Apply



When applying, start with:



I AM A VIDEO EDITOR



Include:



Short introduction



Relevant experience



Portfolio with ad examples



Confirmation you’re comfortable with batch-based editing



? This Role Is Perfect For You If You:



Have edited performance ads



Can create multiple strong variations efficiently



Understand how to hook viewers fast



Can balance speed with conversion quality



Want stable, long-term remote work



???? Not suitable for:



Beginners



Editors without ad experience



People looking for casual or occasional work

title: Experienced WordPress Funnel Builder Needed — CartFlows, ConvertKit, WooCommerce Subscriptions
description:
I am looking for an experienced WordPress funnel builder for a complete funnel build project for a grief counseling and healing membership business.

All copy is written. All strategy is defined. All platforms are selected. I need someone who builds accurately to brief, communicates proactively, and has genuine prior experience in the exact tools listed below.

THIS PROJECT IS IMPLEMENTATION ONLY. No copywriting. No strategy. No design decisions. You build what is provided. 



TECH STACK — PRIOR EXPERIENCE REQUIRED IN ALL OF THESE

WordPress

WooCommerce and WooCommerce Subscriptions

CartFlows Pro

Interact quiz platform

ConvertKit including tag-based automation

Circle community platform

Zapier multi-step integrations

ManyChat Instagram automation

 Pixel via 

Please do not apply if you are learning any of these tools on this project.



 SCOPE OF WORK — SUMMARY

Install and configure CartFlows Pro, WooCommerce Subscriptions, and PixelYourSite

Set up ConvertKit with 23-tag structure and
 sequence automation logic

Build Interact quiz with four result stages and ConvertKit integration

Build two CartFlows checkout flows with order bumps and one-click upsells

Load three
 sequences plus dunning and win-back sequences in ConvertKit

Set up Circle community with six Spaces and Zapier automation for member access

Build seven Zapier integrations connecting all platforms

Install and configure
 Pixel with six standard events

Complete existing ManyChat build using provided script

Run complete ten-path end-to-end testing and document results

Deliver complete Website Master Document before final payment

Full detailed brief provided upon application. 



TIMELINE

Three weeks from project start to funnel launch ready. 



COMMUNICATION REQUIREMENTS

Daily three-sentence update — completed, planned, blockers

Immediate flagging of any blocker

English communication must be clear and responsive within business hours

Weekly thirty minute check-in call required HOW TO APPLY

Please answer these five questions specifically. Applications without all five answers will not be reviewed.

One — Show me one funnel you have built using CartFlows Pro and ConvertKit. Describe your specific role and include a URL if possible.

Two — Describe one WooCommerce Subscriptions project you have built including recurring billing, payment plans, and failed payment handling.

Three — Describe the most complex Zapier integration you have built. How many Zaps, what platforms, what did it connect?

Four — What is your fixed project quote for the complete build described above?

Five — What is your realistic timeline from receiving the full brief to testing complete?

Thank you for reading carefully. I look forward to hearing from you.

Pam Vredevelt Team

title: AirBNB Guest Relations Manager. MUST have 3+ Years AirBNB PM experience
description:
Peak Season Management is a short-term rental management company based out of the Smoky Mountains of NC and TN.  Looking for HIGH PERFORMERS to add immediate value by bringing extremely high work ethic, relevant skills and experience, and outside-the-box thinking to our small but growing company.

      

MUST HAVE 3 Years MINIMUM AIRBNB MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE with a PROPERTY MANAGER 

*PLEASE include a voice (LOOM) sample with application. 



Please DO NOT apply unless you:

1) DO HAVE at least 3 years experience working for a Short-Term Rental Management Company

2) ARE 100% fluent in written AND spoken English with minimal accent and strong understanding of American english.

3) ARE willing to take on multiple roles within a very small company

4) ARE willing to travel for trainings



Please DO apply if you:

1) Are willing to work incredibly hard and have extremely high attention to detail and accountability

2) Are willing to do prove your abilities via our interview period (2 weeks; 4 interviews).

3) Are extremely confident YOU ARE the right fit for a super fast paced job

4) Can well within teams and always GO THE EXTRA MILE. 



Looking for someone who is:

-VERY detailed in logging and following up on maintenance issues

-VERY good at written and spoken guest communication 

-VERY fast learner with higher-than-average IQ and EQ

-VERY familiar with short-term rentals and the complexities that arise

-OBSESSED with 5 star reviews on airbnb/ vrbo/ expedia/ tripadvisor etc.



-Fluent Written and Spoken English and VERY good critical thinking/judgement in handling delicate situations

-3+ Years of AirBNB experience (Guest Relations/ Property Management) 5+ years experience preferred.

-Experience with Guesty, Slack, Clickup, Pricelabs and/or Stripe a PLUS (not required)

-FAST learner who can add value by thinking outside the box to solve hard problems.



NOW OFFERING faster-than-average promotion cycle and compensation increase for our most outstanding performers!! Come join a fast-growing AirBNB property management and investment company!  We are looking for Long-Term, Full-Time employees to grow with us.  We are based out of Gatlinburg, TN and are currently a team of 5 VA's (have been working with me 2 years now) + Handymen/Cleaners.  



LOOKING FOR EXCEPTIONAL CANDIDATES TO GROW WITH OUR TEAM!  We are like a family and I have the tea
et once per quarter to hang out with each other, go to the pool, enjoy.  I care about my team and feel like my team is almost my family.  We are all super friendly, hard-working, and looking for our next SUPERSTAR to help grow our business!  



Job Details:

You will be a Guest Relations Assistant and will be in charge of facilitating smooth check ins/outs, coordinating the cleaning staff, dealing with guest inquiries, requests, complaints, and keeping track of reviews.  You will help populate internal databases and contribute to the ongoing learning of the team by documenting your learnings diligently and assisting in the training of new assistants.



Most important skills:

1) Excellent written, spoken English and able to understand American specific phrases and behaviors

2) EXPERT in AirBNB, Homeaway, 
...

3) VERY HIGH attention to detail and NEVER letting things "fall through the cracks" (Never forgetting when something needs to be done/ HIGHLY accountable for your job to make sure its done fast and right)

4) Good judgement, ultra-professional demeanor, and desire to ensure the guest has a great experience

5) Fast learning curve and a go-getter, always-improving mentality

6) Extremely high organizational skills.   

7) Ability to learn new software and integrate it into your workflow.



Some daily tasks:

1) Handling guest communication and dealing with guest complaints

2) Maintaining the airbnb, homeaway, and 
 listings and calendars to ensure the calendars are accurate, and we are maximizing our bookings.

3) Communicate effectively with our staff and manage and arrange for cleanings/ repairs/ maintenance.

4) Following up aggressively to make sure tasks are being completed (a guest is asking for a toaster and they can't find it!  What do you do?)  hint: ask the housekeeper where it is first; then have them check again; then allow them to purchase one)

5) You get the idea... it's a high-touch, guest relations role where you also help think about how to improve the business.  



If this is of interest, please do let me know so we can set up an interview.  Please send me an updated resume for my review.  



Are you looking for a position working as an AirBNB Virtual Guest Relations Assistant?  The job will be 40 hours/ week with 2 days off.   It's with a an exciting, fast-growing Real Estate Investment company in the Hospitality space.  Our specialty is providing high-touch, excellent guest service at a reasonable cost and empowering our staff to make critical business judgments.   With us, you will truly learn the Hotel/AirBNB business, and is a great start to a career with a fast-growing, fun real estate startup.   Pay will be commensurate with experience and performance on the interview process.  We have occasional parties and trips for the  VA's on to bond and facilitate team-building.We may be looking into getting an office space for our team outside Manila or in Clark/Pampanga.



THANKS FOR YOUR INTEREST!!!





Noah Mencia

CEO of Plethora Capital, Inc.

We're looking for a highly capable Shopify Virtual Assistant who can handle everything from A to Z on our store — independently, accurately, and with an eye for detail. This is not a basic data-entry role. We need someone who takes ownership, solves problems without hand-holding, and genuinely cares about quality.

What You'll Be Doing



Product listing creation — titles, descriptions, tags, variants, pricing, SEO

Image editing and AI image generation for product and store visuals

Custom coding for store elements (Liquid, HTML, CSS — JavaScript is a plus)

Building, sorting, and optimizing collections and navigation

Theme customization and troubleshooting

App installation, configuration, and management

Setting up discounts, bundles, and promotional campaigns

Updating and maintaining store content (banners, pages, announcements)

Store speed and UX improvements

Any other Shopify-related task that comes up



You're a Great Fit If You...

title: JOB TITLE: Instagram Christian Social Media Marketer — Grief and Healing Niche
description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

We are looking for an experienced Instagram social media marketer who understands Christian faith-based content, grief and healing topics, and funnel-driven Instagram strategy. This is a long-term part-time remote position supporting a growing digital healing community for women who have experienced pregnancy and infant loss.

This role is not for a general social media VA. We need someone who genuinely understands the emotional sensitivity required to market to grieving women, the nuances of Christian faith-integrated content, and the specific Instagram strategies that drive quiz completions and funnel conversions.

If you are a strong content scheduler who does not understand funnel strategy and conversion-focused content — this role is not the right fit.

If you understand how Instagram content drives lead generation, how ManyChat automation works alongside organic content, and how to speak to a deeply vulnerable audience with warmth and precision — we want to hear from you.



ABOUT THE BUSINESS

Pam Vredevelt is a Licensed Professional Counselor with 40 years of clinical experience, a bestselling author whose book Empty Arms has sold over 200,000 copies, and the author of Mending Miracles — a number one bestseller endorsed by celebrated author Anne Patchett.

Pam and her daughter Jessie co-lead a digital healing community — the Healing Path Community — for women healing from miscarriage, stillbirth, ectopic pregnancy, SIDS, and infant loss. The business includes a quiz-based lead generation funnel, personalized healing guides, a professional online course, and a monthly membership community with live



WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

You are the right person for this role if all of the following are true.

You have at least two years of experience managing Instagram accounts for Christian, faith-based, wellness, or grief-related businesses.

You have experience creating or scheduling content that drives a specific action — quiz completions, link in bio clicks, DM responses, or funnel entries — not just likes and follows.

You understand ManyChat or are willing to learn it immediately. Our entire Instagram lead capture system runs through ManyChat and you will be responsible for monitoring its performance and flagging issues.

You are personally comfortable with Christian faith content. You do not need to share Pam’s faith but you must be able to write and schedule content that integrates scripture, prayer, and Biblical wisdom naturally and respectfully.

You understand grief. You have either personal or professional experience with loss and you understand instinctively why certain words, images, and tones are inappropriate for this audience. You will never post content that feels rushed, toxic-positive, or dismissive of grief.

You communicate proactively. You send updates without being asked. You flag concerns before they become problems. You ask for clarification before interpreting independently.

You are detail-oriented. Every caption, every hashtag, every posting time, every ManyChat keyword matters in a conversion-focused Instagram strategy. Careless execution is not acceptable in this role.



WHAT YOU WILL DO

Content Scheduling and Publishing

Schedule and publish three to four Instagram posts weekly across feed, Reels, and Stories using a content calendar provided and approved by Pam.

All captions are written by Pam or provided in copy documents. Your role is formatting, hashtag optimization, scheduling at optimal times, and confirming publication.

For Reels — download provided video files, add captions burned into video using CapCut or similar tool, format to correct dimensions, and schedule using Meta Business Suite or Later.

For Stories — design story cards in Canva using provided brand templates and copy, add link stickers pointing to quiz or relevant funnel pages, and publish on correct schedule.

For feed posts — format provided images or graphics to correct dimensions, apply provided captions with hashtags, and schedule at optimal posting times based on account analytics.

ManyChat Monitoring and Management

Monitor ManyChat daily for any flow errors, broken triggers, or failed message deliveries.

Respond to flagged conversations requiring personal response — specifically the I Have A Question trigger — within two hours by notifying Pam immediately.

Track keyword trigger performance weekly — how many people triggered each keyword, how many received the quiz link, how many clicked through. Report in weekly analytics summary.

Update ManyChat keyword lists when new campaign keywords are introduced.

Hashtag Research and Optimization

Maintain a master hashtag library of 150 to 200 researched hashtags organized by category.

Categories include pregnancy loss, miscarriage, stillbirth, infant loss, Christian grief, healing journey, faith and healing, women’s wellness, Christian women, grief support, and baby loss awareness.

Rotate hashtag sets across posts to avoid repetition penalties from the Instagram algorithm. No post uses the exact same hashtag set as the previous post in the same category.

Research and add minimum five new relevant hashtags monthly based on trending content in the grief and Christian wellness space.

Analytics and Reporting

Every Monday morning send a one-page weekly analytics report covering the following metrics for the previous week.

Top performing post by reach

Top performing post by saves

Top performing post by shares

Stories average reach and link sticker click rate

Reels average view rate at three seconds and fifteen seconds

Profile visits

Bio link clicks

ManyChat keyword trigger volume

Quiz entries attributed to Instagram traffic — tracked via UTM parameters

Net follower change

Flag immediately any metric that is significantly below the previous week’s baseline. Do not wait for Monday’s report if something is broken.

Content Calendar Management

Maintain a shared content calendar in Google Sheets or Trello updated at least one week in advance at all times.

Calendar shows post date, post type, copy status, design status, approval status, and published confirmation for every piece of content.

Flag any content gaps — days without scheduled content — at least five days in advance so Pam has time to provide new copy or repurpose existing content.

Campaign Coordination

When Pam launches a campaign — journal review request, membership open enrollment, podcast episode release, book promotion — coordinate the Instagram campaign elements across feed, Reels, and Stories according to the campaign deployment schedule provided.

Ensure all campaign content is scheduled correctly, all link stickers point to correct destinations, and all ManyChat keywords relevant to the campaign are active and tested before campaign launch date.



WHAT YOU WILL NOT DO

You will not write original copy from scratch without Pam’s input. All messaging decisions belong to Pam. You may suggest copy adjustments for formatting or character limits but you do not change the meaning or tone of any content independently.

You will not post anything that has not been approved by Pam. Every piece of content — feed post, Reel, Story card — requires Pam’s approval before publishing. Build your workflow around this requirement.

You will not engage in comment conversations on behalf of Pam without explicit written guidelines for how to respond. When in doubt, flag for Pam rather than responding independently.

You will not make strategic decisions about content direction, campaign timing, or audience targeting without Pam’s input. Your role is expert execution of defined strategy — not strategy creation.



TOOLS YOU MUST KNOW

Required — prior experience essential:

Meta Business Suite — scheduling and analytics

Canva — story card and graphic design using provided brand templates

ManyChat — flow monitoring and keyword management

Google Sheets or similar — content calendar management

CapCut or similar — Reel caption burning and basic video formatting

Required — willing to learn immediately if not already familiar:

Later or Planoly — alternative scheduling tool if preferred

UTM parameter tracking — basic understanding of how to add UTM parameters to links for traffic attribution

Meta Ads Manager — basic familiarity for coordinating organic content alongside paid ad campaigns



CHRISTIAN CONTENT REQUIREMENTS

This is a faith-integrated business. Christian content is not a peripheral element — it is central to who Pam is and who her audience is. You must be able to work confidently with the following content types.

Scripture graphics — formatting and scheduling posts that feature Biblical verses relevant to grief and healing

Prayer prompts — posts that invite the audience into prayer or reflection

Faith and neuroscience content — posts that bridge clinical healing science with Biblical wisdom

Testimony content — posts that share transformation stories through a faith lens

Holiday and liturgical calendar awareness — understanding which Christian holidays and observances are relevant to your posting schedule. Mother’s Day, Christmas, Easter, and Advent are particularly significant for a pregnancy loss audience and require thoughtful content planning in advance.

If you are uncomfortable with any of these content types please do not apply.



SCHEDULE AND AVAILABILITY

This is a part-time role requiring approximately fifteen to twenty hours per week.

You must be available for a weekly thirty-minute check-in call with Pam at a mutually agreed time. Calls are held via Zoom.

You must be reachable by
 or messaging app within four hours during your working hours Monday through Friday.

Urgent flags — ManyChat failures, broken links, campaign errors — require response within two hours regardless of day.

Time zone flexibility is required. Pam is based in Central time USA. You do not need to work Central hours but you must have sufficient overlap for weekly calls and prompt communication.



COMPENSATION

This is a negotiable monthly retainer based on experience and demonstrated results.

Expected range: $400 to $800 USD per month for fifteen to twenty hours weekly.

Candidates with documented experience driving Instagram lead generation and funnel conversions for Christian or faith-based businesses will be considered at the higher end of this range.

Candidates whose experience is primarily content scheduling without conversion focus will be considered at the entry level of this range with performance review at ninety days.

This role has growth potential. As the Healing Path Community scales and paid ad campaigns launch alongside organic content, the scope and compensation of this role will grow with demonstrated results.



HOW TO APPLY

Please answer all five questions below. Applications that do not address all five questions will not be reviewed. We are looking for someone who reads carefully and communicates specifically — your application is the first demonstration of both.

Question One

Describe one Instagram account you have managed for a Christian, faith-based, grief, or healing-related business. What was the account about, what was your specific role, and what measurable result did your work contribute to?

Question Two

Have you worked with ManyChat before? If yes describe one specific flow you built or managed and what it was designed to do. If no describe your experience with Instagram automation tools and your willingness to learn ManyChat before starting.

Question Three

This role serves women who have experienced miscarriage, stillbirth, and infant loss. Describe in two to three sentences how you would approach creating and scheduling content for this specific audience. What would you never do and why?

Question Four

Describe your experience with conversion-focused Instagram content — content designed to drive a specific action like a link click, DM response, or quiz completion. Give one specific example.

Question Five

What is your proposed monthly retainer for fifteen to twenty hours per week and what tools do you currently use for content scheduling and analytics?



ONE FINAL NOTE

This role requires someone who genuinely cares about the women this business serves. Behind every Instagram impression is a grieving mother searching for something that understands her pain. The content you schedule and the ManyChat flows you monitor are the first point of contact between her and a resource that could genuinely change her healing journey.

We do not take that lightly. We hope you won’t either.

If this resonates with who you are and how you work — we look forward to hearing from you.

Pam Vredevelt Team

title: Editor for TikTok Shop Videos
description:
Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:



Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.



Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:



Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.







Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.









You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page, and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

Attention to detail

STRONG English

Strong internet connection

Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

Good working with a team

Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

Availability to work 3-4h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as you are consistent and videos are being completed)

Can take payments through Wise

PH or similar time zone



$300-$400/month + bonuses for 3-4h/day MAX, with potential for full-time work in the future and a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (1h max)



Below is a Google Drive with the original files you will need to re-create with a reference video:



Google Drive: 



Talking head reference video: 



Talking head raw video Google Drive:


 



Overlay reference video: 





Overlay raw video Google Drive:


 



Please complete the following steps:



Talking Head

Download the files and import into your video editing software

Cut out all dead space between videos

Each clip should flow smoothly into the next with minimal to no pause between words

Tip: cut the clip .2-.3 seconds shorter than the end of the word said.

Do not use transitions between clips, static clips only.

Message me with a link to re-create the video



Overlay

Download the files and import into your video editing software

Cut out all dead space between videos

Each clip should flow smoothly into the next with minimal to no pause between words

Tip: cut the clip .2-.3 seconds shorter than the end of the word said.

Using the reference video and context, place overlays in the proper spots

Pay attention to overlay position and length

Make them big enough to see/read, but not so big they dominate the screen

Do not use any transitions, static overlays only



Message me a link to your re-created video where I can download it.



Please respond back to me beginning with the word “blue”; if you don´t write “blue” I will not review your application.



Looking forward to work with you!



Best of luck!

title: Kommo CRM Automation Specialist (Salesbot & AI Focus)
description:
Kommo CRM Automation Specialist (Salesbot & AI Focus)

(This is a role for an expert, not someone still learning)



Overview

I Go Panama is a virtual, bilingual (English/Spanish) team of five based in Panama. We use a single Kommo Advanced seat to manage high-volume inquiries from tourists and businesses. We are looking for an independent consultant (not an agency) to help us automate our lead triage and engagement using Salesbots and AI.



The Project Scope

We have a fixed initial budget of $500. We are looking for the maximum "basics" setup possible within this budget, focused on our five existing pipelines. Our goal is to reduce manual triage and ensure high-value leads reach our salesperson quickly.



Technical Environment:

Channels: FB, IG, TikTok,
, and 2x WhatsApp Lite numbers.

Current State: Pipelines are built; customers are imported; basic templates are in use.

Immediate Need: Salesbot logic to automate "Education & Encouragement" flows and lead movement.



Priority & Logic Requirements

We have ranked our needs by priority. Please specify how many of these flows you can build within the $500 budget:



Priority 1: INDIVIDUALS (High Volume Triage)

Goal: Automate "Education & Encouragement" via bot.

Logic: Provide a "Free Join" link for our directory. If no interaction occurs within 10 days, auto-delete the lead to keep the CRM clean.



Priority 2: HOTELS (High Revenue)

Goal: Dedicated bot flow for hotel-specific arguments/packages.

Logic: Qualify and immediately notify/push to our salesperson for 1-on-1 interaction.



Priority 3: CUSTOMERS (Onboarding)

Goal: Post-signup care.

Logic: Trigger educational drips and upsell prompts for additional marketing services once a lead is moved to this stage.



Priority 4: BUSINESSES

Goal: Similar to Hotels, but for service providers (Relocation, Legal, etc.).

Logic: Bot-led qualification and hand-off to sales.



Priority 5: COMMUNITY ORGANIZERS

Goal: Long-term nurturing.

Logic: Re-engagement drip every few weeks for non-conversions.



Consultant Requirements

No Agency Upselling: We are not looking for a "digital transformation" partner or a $5k implementation. We need a technical builder who respects the $500 starter budget.

Bilingual Capability: Must be comfortable working in English or Spanish.

Technical Fit: You must have specific experience with Kommo Salesbots and AI triggers.

Timeline: We intend to select a partner within 48 hours and complete the initial setup within 7–10 days.



How to Apply



Please respond with:



A brief summary of a similar Kommo automation project you’ve completed.



A specific breakdown of which priorities (1 through 5) you can realistically deliver for the $500 budget.

Your availability to start this week.



You may apply directly here, or you can

title: Design Operations Coordinator (Canva + Shopify) , Fashion
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing luxury uniform and lifestyle brand serving leading hospitality and wellness clients globally. Our brand is built on quiet luxury, elevated design, and exceptional client experience. We’re looking for a creative professional who can not only design beautiful materials, but also bring structure and organization to our entire design ecosystem.



Role Overview

We’re hiring a Philippines-based Creative Designer who is highly skilled in Canva and Shopify and can also own and manage our design organization and workflows.



This role works directly with the Founder and Product Development team to:

Create compelling, client-ready presentations

Maintain a highly organized system for all design assets

Ensure smooth communication between design, product development, and manufacturing

This is a mix of creative design + operational ownership — ideal for someone who is both artistic and highly organized.



Key Responsibilities

1) Canva & Client Presentations (Primary Creative Work)

Translate client vision and Founder direction into luxury, client-ready Canva presentations

Create:

Uniform design proposals

Lookbooks

Mood boards

Color stories and fabric concepts

Sales presentations

Maintain a clean, elevated aesthetic aligned with a luxury fashion brand

Execute revisions quickly and accurately

2) Design Organization & Asset Management (Critical Ownership Area)

You will own and manage our entire design library.

Organize and maintain:

Design files

Pattern files

Tech packs

Fabric and trim references

Client-specific folders

Final approved versions

Create and maintain a clear folder structure and naming system

Ensure the team is always working from the latest approved files

Keep everything streamlined, easy to find, and audit-ready

Support version control and archive outdated materials

3) Cross-Team Communication

Work closely with the Founder on creative direction

Coordinate with the Product Development team

Share organized files with manufacturing vendors when needed

Ensure vendors receive accurate, complete, and clearly labeled materials

Follow up to confirm files and revisions are understood

4) Shopify (Website Support)

title: eBay Listing Specialist (Retail Arbitrage | High Volume)
description:
eBay Listing Specialist (Retail Arbitrage | High Volume)



We are a US-based eCommerce seller looking for a reliable and detail-oriented eBay Listing Specialist.



We sell brand new retail products and are scaling aggressively. We need someone who understands Sold Listings, pricing strategy, and can list high volumes accurately.



This is a long-term opportunity.



Responsibilities:



Create eBay listings using product information we provide



Search product using barcode or image



Filter by Sold Listings to determine pricing



Calculate price including shipping and fees



Write SEO titles if exact listing does not exist



Use “Sell Similar” when appropriate



Fill out item specifics correctly and completely



Update expiration dates if applicable



Upload photos from Google Drive



Revise listings weekly if unsold



Requirements:



Minimum 1 year experience listing on US eBay accounts (REQUIRED)



Strong understanding of Sold vs Active listings



Comfortable doing pricing math



High attention to detail (no pricing or shipping mistakes)



Able to complete 40–70 listings per day accurately



Stable internet connection



Good written English



Compensation:



$3–$4/hour depending on experience



20 hours per week trial (2 weeks)



Opportunity to move to full-time (40 hours/week)



Bi-weekly payment



Long-term role with growth potential



To Apply, Answer the Following:



What experience do you have listing on eBay?



Describe step-by-step how you use Sold Listings to determine pricing.



What is the difference between Active listings and Sold listings?



If the average sold price for an item you want to list is $29.99 with free shipping, 

and our store is running 20% off all products, and our shipping cost is $8.29 flat rate, how would you calculate the correct listing price so it is a 1-3 dollars cheaper? Show your math.



How many listings can you complete per day accurately?



Type the word PROFIT at the top of your application.

We are also building a video and podcast presence to educate the community and drive traffic to our website and YouTube channel.

 follow-ups)

• Strong written English

• Thinks in systems, not just tasks

title: UREGENT | Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
IMPORTANT: If you are interested and qualified, please submit a link to your resume AND your voice recording to 
 will only process applications of those who will send both. Applications sent through OLJ will be automatically discarded. DO NOT apply if you do not have the experience.



Senior Full Stack Developer (Distributed Systems &

Computational Modeling)



Role Overview: We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our core

engineering team building a proprietary platform for high-stakes industrial simulations and

capital project optimization. You will be responsible for developing the underlying

framework that manages complex, multi-stage computational pipelines. Your work will

focus on the seamless integration of heavy backend processing with a responsive, datarich

user experience, ensuring the reliable execution of sophisticated resource and design

optimizations.



Technical Requirements

1. Backend & Distributed Systems (Python Core):

• High-Performance Python: Advanced proficiency in Python, specifically utilizing

numerical and scientific libraries for large-scale data manipulation and algorithmic

optimization.

• Asynchronous Architecture: Extensive experience with distributed task queues

(e.g., Celery) to manage long-running, interdependent background processes and

complex workflow signatures.

• Algorithmic Implementation: Strong background in applied mathematics,

including spatial geometry, graph theory, and network flow optimization.

• Data Lifecycle Management: Expertise in managing state across distributed

systems using high-performance caching layers and persistent databases.



2. API & Real-Time Infrastructure:

• Framework Mastery: Deep experience with Python-based web frameworks (e.g.,

Django) for building robust, secure, and scalable API architectures.

• Real-Time Data Streaming: Proficiency in implementing WebSockets or similar

protocols to provide live telemetry and status updates from background engines to

the end-user.

• System Integrity: Experience designing systems that maintain strict data

consistency across multi-step, automated computational workflows.



3. Frontend & Visualization:

• Data-Intensive UIs: Ability to build sophisticated interfaces for managing complex

input parameters and visualizing multi-variable simulation outputs.

• Spatial Visualization: Experience rendering and manipulating 3D geometric entities

(vertices, faces, and polylines) within the browser to provide visual validation of

backend calculations.





Key Responsibilities:

• Bridge the gap between high-level logical planning and low-level computational

execution.

• Optimize the performance of proprietary spatial and geometric algorithms.

• Build the infrastructure that allows users to audit and interact with complex,

automated engineering decisions in real-time.

• Maintain and scale a distributed environment where background tasks must operate

with high reliability and low latency.





Preferred Qualifications:

• Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or a related

Engineering field.

• Proven track record of building "Human-in-the-loop" systems where users interact

with complex automated processes.

• Prior experience in fields such as industrial automation, logistics, CAD software

development, or advanced manufacturing simulations.

• Familiarity with mining/energy industries is a plus.



IMPORTANT: If you are interested and qualified, please submit a link to your resume AND your voice recording to 
 will only process applications of those who will send both. Applications sent through OLJ will be automatically discarded. DO NOT apply if you do not have the experience.

 (communication)

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

STYLE REFERENCE — THIS IS WHAT YOUR WORK SHOULD LOOK LIKE

Watch these channels carefully. This is the quality, pacing, and storytelling level I expect:

 edits

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

WHO YOU ARE (must-haves)

 You have real experience with AI video generation tools (Veo3, Runway, Kling, Pika, or similar)

/month within 3-6 months.

????????????????????????????????????????????????????

HOW TO APPLY (read this carefully — seriously)

Instead, do this:

 Write the word "GLACIER" at the very top of your message.

WHY WORK WITH ME?

Honest truth:

 Steady, consistent work — not a random one-off project.

 I handle all the scripting — you focus purely on the visual/editing side.

 Room to grow as channels scale.

 I'm picky about quality. If pacing is off, I'll ask for revisions.

 Volume is real — 60 videos/month means you need to be efficient.

 I expect communication — if something is delayed, tell me before the deadline, not after.
